amendment.description: To direct the Secretary of Homeland Security to train Department of Homeland Security personnel how to effectively deter, detect, disrupt, and prevent human trafficking during the course of their primary roles and responsibilities.

vote.text: Amendment SA 1122 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

action.text: Amendment SA 1122 proposed by Senator Cornyn for Senator Heller. (consideration: CR S2333-2337; text: CR S2335-2336) To direct the Secretary of Homeland Security to train Department of Homeland Security personnel how to effectively deter, detect, disrupt, and prevent human trafficking during the course of their primary roles and responsibilities.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 1122 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 1122 proposed by Senator Cornyn for Senator Heller.
